565090.name: Lucky St. Patrick's Shamrock - Home Remedy Toy
565090.notes_html:
Here’s a knitted shamrock, which is home decoration, toy, and home remedy all in one, because it is cute and it can be used as a hot-and-cold pack!

The finished shamrock/clover will be about 6x6x2 inches (15x15x2.5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. The yarn should be microwaveable and washable, if it’s to be used as home remedy. I recommend to fill it with dry beans, but lentils or corn work as well. You may also be able to use a small hot-and-cold gel pack.

This is a pattern suitable for ambitious beginners. It will take about 3 hours to make on average.

You need to be comfortable using double pointed needles, but the toy doesn’t have to be knit in the round - there is also an option to knit flat. Even the in-the-round version requires seaming though. Otherwise the making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit, purl, increase, decrease, and embroidery. An I-cord and crocheting is optional.

Happy St. Patrick’s Day and Good Luck - always!

Both my grandmothers taught me how to crochet and how to knit when I was just a little kid. They kindled my interest by showing me new patterns and challenging me to start new projects until I was completely and utterly hooked.

When I went to the US in 2012, I found myself in the lucky position to have the head space and time to learn again and follow my dreams, pursue my hobbies and indulge my passions - like knitting for example.

Now, I’m back in Germany. But knitting never stops.

567119.name: Well Tempered Ladybug
567119.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as an hot-and-cold pack and teether!

My samples are about 5x5x2 inches (13x13x2.5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. You can use thinner yarn double-threaded. But, please, make sure it’s microwaveable and washable, if you want to use it as home remedy. You will need approx. 50 yards of red-ish and dark (blue or black worsted weight yarn (little more dark than red) and some dark scrap yarn, 1-2 cups of dry corn, beans or lentils.

I recommend to fill it with dry lentils, because are very pliable and soft, but dry corn or beans, or a mix of these will work as well. The pattern gives tips for easy reopening.

The body is knit flat, there are instructions for knitting head and feet flat or in-the-round. Otherwise the making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit, purl, increase, decrease, and some seaming and embroidery. Crocheting, adding velcro or a cotton liner are optional.

This is a pattern suitable for ambitious beginners. It will take about 3 hours to make on average.

Please check out my other “well tempered patterns” - proceeds are going towards yarn and other supplies, like beans for example. My charity knitting group “craft around corners” makes toys and other hand-knit items, which are donated to various good causes. With the proceeds of only one of the patterns we can make about ten toys!

567129.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as a hot-and-cold pack and teether! My samples are about 5x5x2 inches (13x13x2.5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. You will need approximately 50 yards altogether of green-ish and orange-ish worsted weight yarn (little more green than orange) and some dark scrap yarn and 1-2 cups of dry corn, beans or lentils. The body is knit flat or in-the-round, and there are instructions for knitting head and feet flat or in-the-round on two needles. 567612.name: Well Tempered Flower
567612.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as an hot-and-cold pack and teether!

My samples are about 6x6x2 inches (15x15x2.5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. You can use thinner yarn double-threaded. But, please, make sure it’s microwaveable and washable, if you want to use it as home remedy.

I recommend to fill it with dry lentils, because are very pliable and soft, but dry corn or beans, or a mix of these will work as well. You may also use a gel pack. The pattern gives tips for easy reopening.

The body can be knit flat or in the round. There are instructions for knitting the petals in-the-round on two needles (directly onto the body) or on three needles separately. Otherwise the making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit, purl, increase, decrease, and some seaming - in case you choose to knit the petals separately.

Please check out my other “well tempered patterns” - proceeds are going towards yarn and other supplies, like beans for example. My charity knitting group “craft around corners” makes toys and other hand-knit items, which are donated to various good causes. With the proceeds of only one of the patterns we can make about ten toys!

Crocheting, using a strip of velcro instead of an obvious seam, a cotton liner, and an I-cord are optional.

575893.name: Well Tempered Heart
575893.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as a hot-and-cold pack! My samples are about 4x4x2 inches (10x10x2.5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. You can use thinner yarn double-threaded. But, please, make sure it’s microwaveable and washable, if you want to use it as a hot-pack. You will need approximately 50 yards altogether of a color of your choice, some scrap yarn and 1-2 cups of dry corn, beans or lentils. I recommend to fill the toy with dry beans, because are very pliable, but large enough not to escape too easily. The pattern gives tips for easy reopening. Optional materials are 4 stitch markers and a cotton liner bag for the filling.

The heart is knit mainly in-the-round. Otherwise the making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit, purl, increase, decrease, and some seaming.
Please check out my other “well tempered patterns” - proceeds are going towards yarn and other supplies, like beans for example. My charity knitting group “craft around corners” makes toys and other hand-knit items, which are donated to various good causes. With the proceeds of only one of the patterns we can make about ten toys!

578145.name: Well Tempered Football
578145.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as a hot-and-cold pack! My samples are about 6x3x2 inches (15x8x5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. You can use thinner yarn double-threaded. You will need approximately 50 yards altogether, mostly orange or brown, preferably variegated, some white yarn and 1-2 cups of dry corn, beans or lentils. It’s knit partly in the round, partly flat. Otherwise the making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit, purl, increase, decrease, and some seaming.

605348.name: Breastfeeding prop
605348.notes_html:
This is a breast feeding prop to help breastfeeding consultants or peer supporters help mothers learn to breastfeed without need to manhandle boobs.

You want a firm material that will not be gappy and will with stand machine washing. If you hook loosely then you may want to reduce hook size to 3.25 or even 3mm. For me 3.5mm was perfect.

Any yarn is perfect for this so long as it’s DK weight.

This breast is made with the view to send to the charity flat, without making in two pieces. If you plan to stuff yourself ingnore the instructions about chains in rounds 27-28 and just decrease as normal. Stuff as you go along.

611824.name: Loom Knitted Knockers
611824.sizes_available: B, C, D, and DD Cups
611824.notes_html:
This is a special design that is approved by the President of Knitted Knockers, not other loom knitted design is approved as of yet, but this one is. It is knitted on a CinDwood 56 peg 1/4” gauge loom. It is knitted flat with a near invisible bind off, thanks to the inspirations of Brenda Myers!!! It comes with a video tutorial for assistance in making them. It is done with a flat knit as it is the tightest you can get using super fine yarn. This pattern is meant to be used with DK or finer yarn. If you want an alternative for a loom the KB looms should be fine.
The yarn amount I have given is for approximately 1 knocker, but a skein will make more than a pair.

618700.name: Comfort Rice Bag
618700.notes_html:
I designed this simple crochet comfort rice bag out of personal necessity for myself. I suffer from headaches and any kind of relief in the moment is much needed. They do say, the best ideas come from “see a need, fill a need” concepts.

Why buy something from the store when I have the yarn, cheap pair of pantyhose and rice in my kitchen. I can do it myself. Please enjoy my free pattern and I would love to see what ideas you can come up with for colors.

The pillow will be about 7″ high by 13″ long.
618700.notes:
I designed this simple crochet comfort rice bag out of personal necessity for myself. I suffer from headaches and any kind of relief in the moment is much needed. They do say, the best ideas come from “see a need, fill a need” concepts.

Why buy something from the store when I have the yarn, cheap pair of pantyhose and rice in my kitchen. I can do it myself. Please enjoy my free pattern and I would love to see what ideas you can come up with for colors.

The pillow will be about 7″ high by 13″ long.

689517.name: Softies
689517.sizes_available: A-5” (B-5.5”, C-6”, D-6.5”, E-7”) across the center
689517.notes_html:
Softies are hand knitted prostheses for breast cancer survivors. Knitters love the way they start and find the pattern is quickly memorized. The shaping on the back is reminiscent of shaping the crown of a hat. The size of the Softies can be customized by adding or removing some of the fill through the opening in the back.

To donate Softies, contact your local Breast Care Center or medical centers that care for these women.

Thank you Arlene for your friendship and pictures.

users.about_me:
As a little girl I dreamed about the day when I would become a member of “the knitting group” but first I had to learn how to knit!  On a summer afternoon, my mother demonstrated a few stitches, watched the laborious execution of a few, and with her encouragement, I learned to knit; I was probably six years old.  Over time, I orchestrated a knitting life that encompasses designing, teaching, and writing.  Knitting is my constant companion because within my hands and within my heart I hold the unequivocal gratitude for my mother’s patience and insight, and for the many others who continue to enrich my journey every day.

Knitting has become even more important as I continue my journey as a courageous care partner. Please support "Courageous Care Partners" by signing up for my website: https://eileenadler.com/contact

My blog includes helpful hints and Self-care Rituals and can be found at
https://eileenadler.com/blog

"Courageous Care Partners," my book, includes stories about women who should not have succeeded given the obstacles they faced but they did. Each imparts a Life Lesson and a Self-care Ritual to inspire us. The book features easy-to-fix recipes, poems, knitting patterns, vignettes, and inspiring stories. My journey began many years ago and the information included sustains me. My hope is that you will find support as well.

https://eileenadler.com

Thank you.

704977.name: Well Tempered Cupcake
704977.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as an hot-and-cold pack! It’s also a great gift - it’s sweet yet sugar and gluten free :)

My samples are about 6x6x2 inches (15x15x2.5 cm) in worsted weight yarn. You can use thinner yarn double-threaded. But, please, make sure it’s microwaveable and washable, if you want to use it as home remedy.

I recommend to fill it with dry lentils, because are very pliable and soft, but dry corn or beans, or a mix of these will work as well. You may also use a gel pack.

The making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit and purl in the round, and decrease. For the tiny fruit on top there’s a crochet and a knit option. You may also use felted fruit or a tiny pompom or button instead.

Buon Appetit!

Please check out my other “well tempered patterns” - proceeds are going towards yarn and other supplies, like beans for example. My charity knitting group “craft around corners” makes toys and other hand-knit items, which are donated to various good causes. With the proceeds of only one of the patterns we can make about ten toys!

users.about_me:
Both my grandmothers taught me how to crochet and how to knit when I was just a little kid. They kindled my interest by showing me new patterns and challenging me to start new projects until I was completely and utterly hooked.

When I went to the US in 2012, I found myself in the lucky position to have the head space and time to learn again and follow my dreams, pursue my hobbies and indulge my passions - like knitting for example.

Now, I’m back in Germany. But knitting never stops.

727756.name: Gebreide Borstprothese
727756.sizes_available: Cup A, B, C, D, DD, E, EE, F, FF, G, GG etc.
727756.gauge_description: 23 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in tricot
727756.notes_html:
Meerdertechniek:

  1. draad tussen steek ophalen en gedraaid breien zowel op de rechte als de averechte kant.
  2. recht voor en achter insteken op de goede kant alleen

Minder techniek:
Twee steken samenbreien zowel recht als averecht

3 Markeerders nodig, zonder is niet aan te raden. Je kunt het beste een draadje ervoor gebruiken geen grote markeerders. Ik gebruik hele kleine rubberen elastiekjes die je in de drogist kunt die kopen per 100 ofzo voor rastastaartjes.

Matrassteek voor het dichtnaaien van de gebreide borstprothese. Op Youtube te vinden of in mijn instructievideo op www.debreischool.com of Youtube.

Vulling: polyester, liefst gesiliconiseerde holle vezel (Panda of Hema)

Katoen is het beste mee te breien vanwege de gevoelige huid van de geamputeerde borst. Bamboe is ook heel zacht. En een gemixed katoengaren kan ook volgens de Knitted Knockers HQ.

1038337.name: Fingerless Arthritis Gloves Knit Flat
1038337.gauge_description: 28 stitches and 40 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette stitch
1038337.notes_html:
#9 On Ravelry’s Hot Right Now List on 25th October 2020. I designed these gloves specifically to relieve some pain of arthritis patients. Nowadays people of both sexes suffer from arthritis, and not just old people but also people as young as teenagers who are spending time on mobile cellphones and computers. I designed the cable pattern and positioned it specially to grip hands where required. It was designed to give relief to people who simply cannot stop work, but is of help when used in addition to soaks in warm water to which rock salt has been added, and the special exercises for relieving arthritis pain.
There is nothing quite so satisfying as creating something new – especially when you do it all by yourself. The view from the top of the mountain, when you have climbed it, is more beautiful than can ever be imagined. So if you are stuck with performing a task all by yourself, don’t focus on that, reach out for help…focus instead on the fact that there’s no one else who’ll share the praise you get when all is said & done!

Make music in your soul! When was the last time you relished the love of warmth from a knitted item? It’s waiting to give you a taste of pure goodness! Radiating warmth to give you perfect happiness. Think about it…. It’s all you need to make everyday refreshing. Every day choices make every day beautiful! Nourishment for the body and the soul are equally important and profoundly correlated to each other, is what I truly believe, so be careful not only to look after what you eat & drink, but find your equilibrium in creating things. Quick knitting patterns are awesome. Especially on 2 straight needles! You reap the rewards of your knitting work almost immediately. This pattern is specially designed to give some relief from arthritis pain in hands, & carpal tunnel pain relief as well, all the year round…not just in spring, but also in rainy / cold weather.
It’s charming! Don’t wait too long to discover the secret magic woven into it. Lifestyles are defined by thoughts of excellence. And thoughts of excellence are sometimes defined by lifestyles. My original designer patterns are a pleasure, an exclusivity to be enjoyed: placing you among the privileged distinctive.
Who says money can’t buy happiness? Buy #Yarn, #bringhomehappiness. Come on home. Enhance your knitting experience with my patterns. They are an aesthetic delight. Something new. Something different. All things wonderful. Where fashion is love. Go to your happy place & enjoy! Celebrate perfection in every detail. Happy Knitting. It makes you blessed! Not stressed! Baie Liefde from my home to yours.

pattern_author.name: Knitting Nani Thelma
pattern_author.notes:
Experience. expertise & innovation to bring you dream designer knitting patterns. Happiness is indeed handmade with love!
On 21st May, the 21st day, in the 21st week, of the 21st year, in the 21st century, i designed Cabled Socks for Less Arch, for a stranger who'd had surgeries, & so had flat feet. Just like clothes are specially tailored, if anyone wants a knitted item especially designed for them, please give me a shout out! I'll be thrilled to help. 
i have 28 Patterns which were on Ravelry’s Hot Right Now List between Sept.2020 &  June 2023.  Thanks for all your love. 
I design knitting patterns. They come in my head & I write them down on the nearest piece of scrap paper. I adore making flamboyant, elegant, exclusive patterns which will make you feel special. I leave a part of my soul in each of my designs. I uploaded Mystery Passion for Life Shawl/Wrap during these pandemic times for people to calmly stay cheerful, healthy and happy at home when they knit. 
I have always aspired to be on the Hot right now List. I am so blessed to have been #1 on the Hot List, more than once! And reached within the Top 10 on the other occasions. Thanks to those who added my designs to their favourites and have queued it! I see nearly 2800 downloads, for Beginner's DK Berroco Socks on 92-02-2022. 
I like to challenge my brain & make every next new pattern one step better, more grand, more unique. 
A retd teacher I depend on yarn support to create my original patterns. I appreciate each & everyone of you! Please link your creations to my patterns. That's a great way of saying thanks, to me, an obsessive designer & knitter. 
In designing I find my calm, my peace,  my purpose.  Do something with your lives! Leave your mark on this world. Plant a tree under whose shade you know you will never rest. Be kind!
Baie liefde from my home to yours <3
Kindly note: My designs are copyrighted and for personal use only. Not for commercial use.

Baie liefde from my home to yours <3
Kindly Note: My designs are copyrighted and for personal use only. Not for commercial use.**

Each sock uses about 50 grams of yarn, except the adaptive versions use less.

These handy little pouches for your ice/hot pack were created out of necessity. The calculations to adapt both stitch designs are included in the pattern so you can adjust the size to whatever pack you have.

1141125.name: Spoonie Wrist Cozies
1141125.sizes_available: close small, loose small, close large, loose large
1141125.notes_html:
Spoonie: A term used by people who have chronic illnesses that are often invisible and that cause fatigue. The term was coined by Christine Miserandino when she used spoons to explain the fatigue her lupus caused. A spoonie only gets a limited number of spoons (energy) each day and each day is different. If you start out your day with only 8 or 9 spoons and it takes a spoon to shower, another to get dressed, another for breakfast, and another to drive to work or the grocery store or take the kids to school, it is difficult to get through the day. It becomes necessary to weigh each decision—“If I get a shower, will I still have enough energy to wash a load of clothes so we have clothes for tomorrow?” Or—“If I go grocery shopping today, we are going to have to get takeout tonight because I won’t have enough spoons left to cook let alone clean the kitchen afterward.”

Fibromyalgia introduced me to the spoonie world. Summer air conditioning and fans are painful for me when the air hits my hands. I needed something I could carry with me and use just on my wrists and top of my hands where cold air causes pain. These are perfect for adding protection right where I need it without causing more pain. I hope you also find them useful.

Notes on Fit:
My hands are often swollen and my skin signals pain at the slightest touch, so the loose cozies are made to fit quite loosely. The loose cozies on size 7 needles have about an inch of ease for my comfort level. (30stitches on size 7 needles.)

However, these were big on several of my testers. The close fit feels okay on me, but not when my allodynia is active. For those with even smaller wrists or who want an even closer fit, I would suggest using size 6 needles instead. The great thing is that these are a quick knit so knitting multiple sizes is easy.

A swatch is not recommended because one of these actually has fewer stitches than a swatch would. Knit one and try it on to see before you cut your yarn to find the best size.

There are also 2 optional rows which you can add as many times as you like to make your cozies longer.

users.fave_colors: red, avocado green, eggplant, mustard, raspberry
users.about_me:
I'm a Tennessee girl, but I've lived more than half of my life in China teaching English. Fibromyalgia cut my teaching career short, but since my husband is still teaching, we are still living in China.

As a Spoonie (someone with a chronic ilness that is often invisible), I know what it's like to need easy to knit projects that don't take a lot of brainpower. I also know how important self-care is and how comforting it can be to use and to gift certain comfort items. Knitting is also a great stress reliever and can be very helpful during times of pain.

Designing knitting patterns will allow me to work around flares while bringing comfort and joy to others. What could be better?
